link.title: Promontory School of Expeditionary Learning | Utah

meta.name: description
meta.content: Promontory School of Expeditionary Learning (PSEL) is a public charter school in Perry, Utah. We serve grades K-8 in and around Box Elder County and Northern Utah. PSEL emphasizes active learning, literacy, character growth, and teamwork through Learning Expeditions and the study of Great Thinkers.
Promontory School of Expeditionary Learning | Utah

Promontory School of Expeditionary Learning (PSEL) is a public charter school in Perry, Utah. We serve grades K-8 in and around Box Elder County and Northern Utah. PSEL emphasizes active learning, literacy, character growth, and teamwork through Learning Expeditions and the study of Great Thinkers.

p.span: Ms. Jenn has created a page with some fun art ideas for the students while working from home. You can access it through the "STUDENTS" menu at the top of the home screnn or check it out

span.span: Grab -n- Go Lunches During School Closure

p.span: Under the direction of Governor Herbert, Promontory School will have a soft closure until at least May1st.As you may have heard, this closure is a preventative measure to decrease the spread of the corona virus. During this closure, Promontory has a plan to make school lunch available to all children.

A healthy grab and go bag lunch will be available for pick up during regular school hours from the front office. If you would like a lunch for your child, please order through the link that is emailed to you each day.

On the form, you will see a place for your child's name, grade and any special dietary requirements. This form will be sent out every night during the closure. Please fill out the request before 8 pm at the latest so that the nutrition staff can fill orders and have them ready to pick up the next day.

We appreciate the community working together to minimize any spread of the corona virus. It is our highest priority to producehealthy meals for your children. In order to meet this goal, the kitchen asks that you fill out the form by 8 PM (at the very latest -- earlier is better) the night before a meal is requested.
The price of the meals is the same as always. $2.55 for full price, $0.40 for reduced price, and no payment for free lunch.

span.span: K-8th Grade 2020-2021 Enrollment Lottery is Open

p.span: 1st-8th grade lottery applications are stil being accepted. To enroll in the lottery, please click

If your student has already been through the lottery system and is currently on a waiting list, you do NOT need to enter thatstudent into the lottery again. If you have additional students you are hoping to enroll at Promontory and they have never been through the lottery and therefore are not on any waiting lists, please enter those students in the lottery now. Call the office with ANY questions. We are happy to help you.435-919-1900.
to see the 2020-2021 School Calendar as approved by Promontory School's Governing Board.
to order your yearbook. The code is12405520.

to see the first edition of Promontory School's magazine! It's full of great information and lots of fun pictures of your students. We are currently planning future editions of the magazine. Arethere any particular Promontory topics or questions you'd like to learn more about? Click
to email Nancyand let her know!

a.div: Check out the exciting medieval Day of Knights celebration hosted by the library for students who completed a Book Quest during Reading Madness month. It was a truly amazing event.
The 3/4 Community's new expedition, "Untold Tales of the Rails," sure kicked off with a BANG! The students will be studying the history of the Transcontinental Railroad.
7/8 community students who are designing Promontory's new ropes course and sensory area went on fieldwork to investigate different types of equipment. We are excited to see their finished design!
Promontory Reads is a an exciting program sponsored by our school library. Check out how the students can earn FREE books to KEEP!

span.span: Copyright 2018by Promontory School of Expeditionary Learning
